about.name: Armada Alliance
about.description_short: Alliance of Raspberry Pi and ARM based Stake Pools.
about.description_long: The Armada alliance was formed in efforts to build a sustainable community of decentralized, low-cost, and energy-efficient stake pool operations on the Cardano blockchain üåçüåø All Stake Pools in this alliance run on either Raspberry Pis exclusively or on other low power consuming ARM-based machines with an average pool energy consumption of less than 40 Wattsüí°

items.name: Explore the idea where we set up a treasury where people can delegate to that will be automatically assigned to pools that are in need of delegation using smart contracts
Create a validation page for stake pool members of the alliance to check for missing info
Maintain Armada Alliance Official ARM-based static build using GitHub Actions and put people on a mailinglist for new releases (including pre-releases)
Release a YouTube video on how to setup a cardano node + cli & quick db sync with Docker in under 30 minutes
Explore utility tokens for delegators of our community
Mint specials tokens for delegators of our community
Simplify the registration process for new stake pools, most data already comes from metadata & extended metadata
Support metrics endpoint for stake pools that will expose basic metrics that can be shown on the website
Create a [repository](https://github.com/armada-alliance/armada-alliance) where people can register

navItems.name: What is Cardano?
navItems.description: The blockchain system upon which the Plutus Platform is built.

navItems.name: What is Staking?
navItems.description: The process by which Ada owners can participate in the network and earn rewards by delegating the stake associated with their Ada holdings to a stake pool.

navItems.name: What are Native Assets?
navItems.description: An asset that is interchangeable and indistinguishable with some other asset(s). Same denomination bills and coins are fungible assets, for example, like equal quantities of ada to lovelaces.

navItems.name: What are Smart Contracts?
navItems.description: A smart contract is an automated digital agreement, written in code, that tracks, verifies, and executes the binding transactions of a contract between various parties
